pageContent: Background: Prostate cancer is one of the most common male cancers worldwide. Active Surveillance (AS) has been developed to allow men with lower risk disease to postpone or avoid the adverse side effects associated with curative treatments until the disease progresses. Despite the medical benefits of AS, it is reported that living with untreated cancer can create a significant emotional burden for patients.

metaData.source:
Educational level and first-time PSA testing in general practice
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31663414/
